name: places/ChIJK0gmy4lYwokRIEXVUe5UrzE
formattedAddress: 242 W 76th St, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 242 W 76th St, New York, NY 10023-8232, USA

editorialSummary.text: Refined rooms & suites, some featuring living rooms, in an upscale hotel occupying a 1920s building.

originalText.text:
We stayed here for 2 nights with our toddler for his first visit in NYC and our experience was beyond wonderful. As a native New Yorker & having stayed at many hotels, The Wallace was truly a delight. From the hotel design to decor, the lovely scent in the lobby, the very thoughtful automated light and shade switches and impeccably clean and comfortable rooms - we felt at home.

The entire team from the door staff to the concierge went above and beyond with their excellent service, communication and warm spirit. Every day they greeted and treated our toddler as if he was family. As for location, it was wonderfully quiet and also very close to an endless number of great food options. Very walkable to the AMNH - which was our primary reason for stay - as well as Central Park.

highly recommend, definitely coming back!

originalText.text:
This was our second visit to the Wallace in the last 45 days. This has become one of our favorite hotels in NYC. The rooms are modern, clean, and they have hardwood floors. Very spacious and relaxing. The staff is was nice and friendly.

There are so many restaurants within walking distance, including bakeries for coffee and breakfast.

If I had to find one negative thing, it would be no valet parking. However, within 1 block is parking.

You wonâ€™t be disappointed at the Wallace. I canâ€™t wait to go back.

originalText.text: Absolutely incredible experience, could not have picked a better place to stay! Iâ€™ve stayed in a couple of hotels in NYC and this is beyond the best. The rooms have been updated and are very well kept/clean. Joseph was extremely helpful, very accommodating, professional, welcoming, and made our experience unforgettable! The location was easy walking distance to Central Park and close by to two subway entrances. The lobby was cozy and relaxing! My husbandâ€™s first visit to NYC and this wonâ€™t be our last- definitely make sure to choose The Wallace!

originalText.text: We are very pleased with our stay. The location of the Hotel was convenient to the subway, Central Park, and the American Museum of Natural History. In fact, we walked to Central Park and AMNH. It is also pretty quiet. I couldn't even tell we were staying in a big city. The reception staff was very friendly. It was so nice to sit by the fire place in the lounge to have a drink after a long day of walking around the city. Saturday night, they had a great singer accompanied by a piano player and upright bass. The room was very spacious and the perfect size for my family of 4. The shades and lights were controlled with the touch of a button. The bathroom had great water pressure and hot water. It was my husband's birthday, and they left a special treat and nice note in our room when we checked in. That was a very nice touch that made our trip feel special. I highly recommend this hotel. We will definitely stay here again when we visit the city.

originalText.text: I stayed at the penthouse suite. Itâ€™s incredibly spacious with a living room, kitchen (with free snacks and coffee), deep soaking tub, and the coziest beds! I love how the TV greeted me and it had my name on the screen! Thereâ€™s also high tech controls for the curtains and lights. The lounge has the most delectable bites and live music! Staff are so warm and friendly. Betty checked me in, Morgan seated me at my table, Fiona, Joshua, and Carlos served me dishes with a smile. I even got to meet the chef Lorenzo and the manager Victor! Finally Angel checked me out and was swift doing so! You can really tell the staff here care about you! Thank you for a lovely stay!ðŸ˜Š
